title: pregnant mum loses healthy baby
story: :root Pregnant mum with Covid loses healthy baby after . hour wait in hospital car parkFationa Nikolli was  weeks and four days when she was told she had to wait outside until a single room was free and by which time it was too late to save her baby who was delivered by emergency C-sectionFationa Nikolli claims she lost her baby after being told to wait outside the hospital due to Covid Image: Darren Quinton Birmingham LiveByStephanie BallooTim Hanlon:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep | commentsA pregnant mum claims she lost her healthy baby after being forced to wait in a hospital car park for two and a half hours because she had Covid-.Fationa Nikolli was  weeks and four days into her pregnancy when told she had to wait outside Birmingham Womenaposs Hospital until a single room could be found for her, she told BirminghamLive. The mum-of-two, from Quinton, who had tested positive for coronavirus, travelled the five-minute journey straight to Selly Oak hospital amid fears she could no longer feel the baby at am on July .When she was eventually brought in to the hospital at .pm she underwent an emergency C-section, but sadly her baby was stillborn. Mrs Nikolli claims a doctor said to her: If you had came in before, I could have saved the baby.  Almost three months later, the mum of two boys said she has heard nothing from the hospital - and is still awaiting answers on the tragedy. But after being approached by BirminghamLive, the Birmingham Women’s and Children’s NHS Foundation Trust apologised to Mrs Nikolli and said a probe is underway. The Trust also said it had made immediate changes and improvements to how they manage pregnant women with Covid-. But that is small comfort to Mrs Nikolli, who claims her doctor had examined her the day before the death and had said her baby was healthy. She said: If they had taken me in hospital before, maybe the baby would still be alive. I went with Covid, I called the hospital, I said: aposI want to come because I donapost feel the babyapos. They said: aposYes comeapos and when I got to the hospital, they left me two and a half hours in the car park. Despite pleading with medics that it was an aposemergencyapos, she claims she was told to wait until the hospital had found a separate room, isolated from other patients. She recalled: I said to them aposI canapost feel the baby, you need to bring me inside the hospital straight away and donapost leave me in car parkapos. Iaposd stayed in the car park because they said I could not come inside as I waspositive. They said they needed to find one room for me. I waited outside the hospital two hours and a half and when I got inside, I waited for minutes. She continued: When the doctor came to visit, he said: aposHeaposs still alive but the heart is too slowapos. The doctor said he would do the Caesarean in  minutes but aposit is too late to save the baby,you came inside before, I could save the baby, but itaposs too late nowapos. And I did lose my baby. She continued: When I gave birth, when I lost the baby and I came out from the surgery, they said: aposYour baby is stillbornapos.  They told me I should come see the baby. I told them I didnapost want to, I wasnapost prepared for this. The mum says she had a normal pregnancy up until the tragedy, with her GP saying the baby was healthy just the day before. All my pregnancy was fine, she said. On July  I visited with the GP and they said your baby is very healthy, you are very well, his heart is very, very well. I canapost understand why this happened... just in one day  After the stillbirth, the mum was taken to the Queen Elizabeth Hospital next door to be cared for as the oxygen in her blood was too low due to Covid-. She is now awaiting answers as to what caused the tragedy. I asked the hospital to do the autopsy and they said we need to wait three months, she said.I donapost know anything at the moment, Iaposm waiting. Iaposve called them many times, to know something. Maybe it was because I was positive for coronavirus, I donapost know. Birmingham Women’s and Children’s NHS Foundation Trust said a full investigation was underway and apologised to the mum. Dr Fiona Reynolds, the Chief Medical Officer at Birmingham Women’s and Children’s NHS Foundation Trust, said: “We offer our sincere apologies and condolences to Fationa and her family. We were not able to be there for her in the way we would want or expect. “We have made a number of immediate changes and improvements to how we manage COVID positive women should we experience an increase or surge in attendances to ensure all women and babies are cared for safely. A full investigation into what happened is progressing to enable us to understand why Fationa’s baby died andanything could have been done dferently to avoid this devastating outcome. “We aim for all investigations to involve the family at the centre of care to ensure their voices are heard. A senior midwe has engaged with them with continued, regular contact with Fationa through our Bereavement Midwives who will continue to offer support in any way that they can.” Comment MORE ON Selly Oak HospitalBabiesPregnancyGiving birthStillbirthCoronavirus" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily coronavirus email newsletter with all the news you need to know direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: pregnant teen cell found holding
story: :root Pregnant teen, , found holding dead baby after cries for help ignored for  hoursThe report into the death of the teen prisoner’s baby was published by the Prisons and Probation Ombudsman today, some two years after the tragic event.HMP Bronzefield, where Baby A died Image: TMSByAlice Peacock:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep | commentsA damning report outlines the failures leading up to the discovery of a teenager holding her dead newborn baby in a prison cell in the largest women’s prison in Europe.Theinvestigation reportinto the death of the teen prisoner’s baby was published by the Prisons and Probation Ombudsman today, two years after the horror incident in September , at HMP Bronzefield in Ashford, Middlesex.According toreports, the baby’s death triggered  separate inquiries. A summary of the case outlines the timeline of ‘Miss A’s’ pregnancy, from when she found out she was pregnant whilst in police custody, in February of  to when she was remanded to HMP Bronzefield, on  August . Shortly after her arrival in the cells a midwe in prison determined that Ms A was  weeks pregnant, which would make her expected delivery date from  September to  October.  While this was earlier than originally expected, the midwe did not recalculate this. Ms A was said to have engaged “minimally or not at all” with the midwe team and all antenatal care, including refusing to attend appointments for scans. In September, Ms A told a nurse that she would kill herself or someone her baby was taken away from her after birth a comment that prompted the nurse to discuss with an officer on duty whether it would be necessary to begin Prison Service suicide and self-harm monitoring. While they decided against this, Ms A was put on ‘extended observationsapos by the deputy head of healthcare on September . This meant she should have been checked by a nurse a minimum of twice during the day and twice at night. However, this did not happen. Ms A rang her cell bell shortly after pm that evening and asked for a nurse, though she did not say why. The officer who took the call handed over the information to a colleague, who spoke to Ms A on the phone but cannot remember the conversation.  “No nurse was called for Ms A. . Ms A pressed her cell bell again at .pm. The call was not answered on the house block and was erted to the permanently staffed communications room,” the report continued. “At .pm the call was connected and immediately disconnected. Ms A did not press her cell bell again.” Ms A’s cell was checked twice over the course of the night, but neither of the officers who carried out these checks noticed anything untoward, including blood, in her cell. It wasn’t until .am the next morning that an officer investigated and discovered Ms A had given birth during the night. Shortly after am paramedics confirmed her baby had died. Ms A was taken by ambulance to ASPH and ed to the prison that evening, where she was placed in the prison’s inpatient unit. The pathologist was unable to determine whether Baby A was born alive or was stillborn. The report outlined how the teenager “appeared to have been regarded as dficult and having a ‘bad attitude’ rather than as a vulnerable -year-old, frightened that her baby would be taken away”. Prisons and Probation ombudsman Sue McAllister told thethat Ms A should never have been left in a position where she was forced to give birth alone without medical assistance. The director of HMP Bronzefield called the incident “tragic and extremely sad”. “We are deeply sorry that this happened and our thoughts throughout have been with the family. In the two years which have passed, we have cooperated fully with the PPO investigation,” she said.Dr Kate Paradine, CEO of the charity Women in Prison,in  pleaded thatall mothers should have the right to give birth in dignity.She said: “But time and time again, we hear of situations where this isn’t happening, with mothers regularly being denied access to the vital health and maternity care necessary to give birth safely. This has devastating consequences not only for the baby and mother, but also for the rest of the family they are separated from. She added: Many mothers are imprisoned for being homeless, not having money to pay their bills and not having access to adequate mental health care and substance misuse support. Instead of sending these women to prison, the government needs to urgently prioritise investment in community support services like women’s centres, housing and health care.  Deputy prime minister and justice secretary, Dominic Raab also commented on the incident, which he said was “harrowing and unacceptable”. “We have already implemented the recommendation in the Prisons and Probation Ombudsman’s report. We have put in place important improvements to the care received by women in custody, and across government we must make sure that expectant mothers in prison get the same support as those in the community,” he said.Publication of the report has prompted the organisation of apetitionby organisations Level Up, Women In Prison and Birth Companions, calling for an end to the imprisonment of pregnant women. The groups’ calls have been echoed by the Royal College of Midwives and academics in the field. title: prince andrew finally accepts legal
story: :root Prince Andrew finally accepts legal papers have been served in sex assault caseThe Duke of York now officially has  days to respond to legal documents which accuse him of having sex with Virginia Giuffre against her willPrince Andrew has finally accepted legal papers Image: PAByRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Sep Prince Andrew has finally accepted that he is in possession of legal papers relating to his sex assault case. The Duke of York now officially has  days to respond to legal documents which accuse him of having sex with Virginia Giuffre. The alleged sexual assaults took place at the behest of infamous billionaire paedophile Jeffrey Epstein at properties in London, New York, and the US Virgin Islands. Ms Giuffreaposs lawyer, David Boies, says the prince - who is the Queenaposs second son - has accepted he is in possession of the papers.  The next legal step for the Duke is to ask for a reasonable extension of time to respond to Ms Giuffreaposs complaint. Mr Boies told the Daily Mail: Andrewaposs counsel have agreed that service has been made. Theoretically the clock is now ticking. However, it would be normal for them to ask for, and for us to agree to, a reasonable extension of time to respond to the complaint. A legal filing seen by the US publication also confirmed the documents had been served to the princeaposs lawyer, Andrew Brettler in Los Angeles.A source close to Andrew has claimed that despite his inner circle’s “deep reservations” that his “wall of silence” legal strategy was not working, he has decided to “keep faith and stay loyal” to his UK lawyer Gary Bloxsome of Blackfords.Royal insiders claimed that although the Duke has been stressed and worried over his predicament after Ms Giuffre accused him of sexually assaulting her three times in , the serving of legal papers effectively meant he had run out of time to change course. However, his newly appointed US attorney Andrew Brettler has now taken over the Duke’s case after being appointed just weeks ago. A source claimed the US team were “astonished” at the long held strategy of “no comment” employed by the Duke and his team as he became engulfed in sex abuse allegations by alleged former Jeffrey Epstein sex slave Virginia Giuffre. Another source close to Andrew said: “The Duke remains confident in his legal team and its strategy and is perfectly content to continue to follow their advice.”Most ReadFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Prince Andrew, Duke of YorkRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: prince andrew should relinquish royal
story: :root Exclusive: Prince Andrew should relinquish royal title before Palace insists, says royal expertPrince Andrew should immediately give up his HRH title before the Palace insists on it, after he formally accepted Virginia Giuffres civil sex case papers, writes royal expert and author Nigel CawthorneIt could take five years for the civil case against Prince Andrew to rumble through the US courts Image: Getty ImagesopinionByNigel Cawthorne:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep Prince Andrew should give up his HRH title and any associated duties now that heaposs officially been served by his alleged sexual abuse victim.Following the initial serving of papers in August in the New York civil suit brought by Virginia Giuffre against Andrew, her lawyer David Boies again served papers in Los Angeles on Andrew Brettler as the princeaposs legal representative this Monday.As this is the route that Judge Kaplan suggested in the case, it is almost certain that Kaplan will imminently conclude Prince Andrew has been served.Finally, today, the news is that Andrew’s team has accepted the prince has been duly served. He now has  days to file a response, or risk a judgement by defaultJudge Kaplan considers the evidence brought by Giuffre compels him to do so in the absence of the princeaposs own evidence.As the case is now live, the massive immediate impact of the prince’s acceptance of the suit is not on the prince himself, however. If he contests the suit - which now seems very likely given his army of legal retainers - some experts have said the suit may take five years to reach a conclusion. That’s a long way off, and Andrew has already been living for almost two years behind palace gates with his spoiled dog.Its real weight now bears on the Palace, and particularly the long shadow of five years of legal skirmishes in the headlines. Is it proper for a member of the Royal Family to continue to retain their HRH title while a lawsuit proceeds against them  This is uncharted territory at best, as the prince is adamant that he has no case to answer and has consistently and strenuously denied Giuffreaposs accusations for as long as she has made them. Even so, appearing in court to contest an allegation is a grave matter in its own right. The Queen as head of state must surely rise above any reproach, and doubtless so should all HRHs in the Royal Family. Now that both sides in the suit agree papers have been served, it is dficult to see how the Palace can fail to insist that the prince relinquishes his HRH title to avoid any appearance of the monarchyaposs entanglement with a private matter that affects the prince only. In fact, Prince Andrew should probably offer to do so himself,he hasnapost already.*Nigel Cawthorne is the author of Prince Andrew: Epstein, Maxwell And The Palace Most ReadFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON The QueenPrince Andrew, Duke of YorkRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news prince-harry-branded-professional-whinger-"Ann Widdecombe says we should ‘ignore’ Harry and MeghanByAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep | comments Prince Harry has been branded a professional whinger unaware of his privilege by former Brexit Party MEP Ann Widdecombe.Ann Widdecombe also criticised the Sussexesapos victim mentality saying the couple are privileged beyond belief. She added she disliked how the Duke of Sussex is has continued to speak about his family despite leaving the institution. Ms Widdecombe did not hold her feelings back about the royal couple.She told Express : On a more serious note, I think Harry is very damaging to the royals, he must be personally very hurtful to the Queen.And I think they should keep quiet, I mean they are privileged beyond belief and they moan that they were cut off financially.  Learn all about the secretive personal lives and history of the Royal Family as youaposve never seen them before in Amazonaposs best selling Royal Historical Biographies SEE THE DEALS HERE What a joke, million Calornia mansion, and itaposs just unbelievable. They are privileged, they are professional victims, they are professional whingers and having said that they wanted privacy theyaposve done nothing except publicise every last detail of le.It comes as reports have suggested the Sussexes are keen to visit the UK after quitting as senior royals and moving to Calornia early last year.Harry has only ed to the UK twice since the move, while Meghan and two-year-old Archie have not been back so far.Meanwhile, Harry and Meghanaposs newborn daughter Lilibet has not been to the UK after being born in Calornia in June and is yet to meet her great-grandmother the Queen or her grandfather Prince Charles.And according to Katie Nicholl, a royal expert and author of Harry And Meghan: Le, Loss, And Love told Closer magazine : Christmas is being looked at as an opportunity. There may be a softening, which could pave the way for a healing of the family rt.It’s certainly what the Queen wants. Prince Charles would like to see his grandchildren. A meet-up suggests they hope to move on and sort things out. The Duke and Duchess of Sussex spoke to Oprah Winfrey in March and made a series of claims about the family - including one member reportedly speculating about what colour Archieaposs skin would be and how the palace allegedly failed to support Meghan when she struggled with her mental health. Since then, Harry has done his own interviews where he has spoken about his struggles growing up as a member of the Royal Family. In early , Harry and Meghan stepped down as senior royals and moved to Canada before settling in Calornia where they are now raising their two children - Archie and Lilibet.The royal brothers have only reunited a few times this year, at Prince Philipaposs funeral and at the unveiling of a statue to their mum, Princess Diana, at Kensington Palace on what would have been her th birthday.Comment MORE ON Ann WiddecombePrince HarryPrince Philip, Duke of EdinburghOprah WinfreyPrincess DianaPrince Charles, Prince of WalesKensington PalaceLoveRoyal FamilyMental healthPoliticsChristmas party" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: raf musicians house loses 20000
story: :root RAF musicians house loses £, in value because of overgrown garden next doorFred Sweenie, who played for the Queen, says that his mental health is suffering as a result of the state of his next door neighbours gardenMusician Fred Sweenie, who has performed in Royal shows, says he has become very ill from stress Image: MEN MEDIAByGeorge BunnShiler Mahmoudi:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep | commentsA retired RAF musician has been told his house has lost £, in value because of a neighbouraposs overgrown garden. Musician Fred Sweenie, who has previously played for the Queen, is struggling with his mental health as a result of the issue.The Royal musician from Burntwood once had his property valued by an agent, but was told that the next door house would knock off at least £, from the value of his home.The semi-detached house next door is so overgrown that sunlight is blocked out and the giant trees mean his family cannot enjoy their garden, Staffordshire Live reports.He says that he has spotted rats running around his garden, and that he will never be able to sell his house as potential buyers will be put off by the state of the property next door.  These issues have left him feeling that his country is letting me down, and he is frustrated that for twelve years, nothing has been done to help his situation. Mr Sweenie played in the RAF Central band for  years and has performed at events including garden parties for the Queen and the Cenotaph in London. He has also toured with former Yes keyboardist, Rick Wakeman. The musician and his we Janet, , and son Guy, , have been complaining about the property to Lichfield council for over a decade, and state that no one has occupied the property for  years.  He said: Every time we try to do something it gets blocked. We donapost know why. We first moved into the property in Rugeley Road in . At the time, next door was well kept and well maintained. This really started to go wrong around  years ago. Our first complaint was around  years ago. It came about after we heard a humming noise coming from next door. We enquired and it turned out the wiring was archaic which led us to be worried about a possible fire hazard. Mr Sweenie added: By , the garden next door was having a serious impact on our health and wellbeing.  Rats had started to appear in our garden and we could see the holes where they were coming in. We reported it to environmental health. No response there. So we went to Mr Fabricantwho was fantastic. He wrote numerous times to the council requesting a full investigation into the property. When they did undergo a full investigation, they said that the property was occupied and that, apart from one shed that was full of food waste that had to be knocked down, there was no need to do anything . It made me very ill and we dropped the inquiries in . I was getting nightmares. That was the worst time I think. The house combined with the rats and the fact that we get no light in our garden because of the towering trees really made me ill. All of these issues have meant thathe ever chooses to sell the property, it will be listed for £, less than it is actually worth because of the nightmare garden next door. Head of corporate services at Lichfield District Council Tracey Tudor said: When investigating this type of neighbourhood complaint we need to establish that the condition of land or buildings is harmful to the area, which is not straightforward.  Having visited the garden on Rugeley Road a number of times, we have found that, although is overgrown, it has a clear path from either end, has plants rather than weeds, and is not covered in litter or dumped items. The owner has told us that he likes his plants and trees to attract wildle. While the garden may not be to everyone’s taste, we do not believe it breaches any planning laws that govern complaints of this nature, and when comparing it to similar cases. While some of the neighbours may not like the garden, others do as it does as it attracts birds. Although there is a dference of opinion about how back gardens should be presented, there are insufficient grounds for us to serve a notice. According to Lichfield council, the next door neighbour has agreed to cut back on some vegetation this month as a compromise. title: savvy woman transforms toilet harry
story: :root Savvy woman transforms toilet into Harry Potter-themed Bogwarts - for just £The Royal Mail cleaner had help from her partner Jamie, , as they embarked on the project to make the home they bought two years ago "about the things we love"Claire and her partner Jamie have transformed their downstairs toilet into a Harry Potter-themed world - named Bogwarts Image: Jam Press Claire Stephanie RileyByMilly VincentAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Sep | commentsA woman has transformed her downstairs toilet into a Harry Potter-themed world - named Bogwarts - complete with a broomstick, Marauderaposs Map wallpaper and giant Aragog model. Claire Stephanie Riley, , spent just £ to complete the magical look. The Royal Mail cleaner had help from her partner Jamie, , as they embarked on the project to make the home they bought two years ago about the things we love. Just like Hogwarts, the tiny bathroom features magical knick-knacks from top-to-bottom. It showcases the Marauderaposs Map on the walls to ensure occupants get their mischief managed. Claire, who also owns a dog grooming business, also displays her collection of wands, newspaper clippings from the movie franchise and miniature buildings from the fantasy world.  Even the soap and hand towels are Harry Potter-themed, with cuddly Harry and Hedwig toys looking back at you from the heated towel rail. Claire, from Wigan, said: I have always loved Harry Potter from the beginning. Itaposs just so magical it takes you to another world. Bogwarts came about when I found the Harry Potter wallpaper in BM. Not only is our downstairs loo done in Harry Potter but also our hallway that leads to it.  “My partner Jamie and I moved in around two years ago and we decided to make our home about things we love. “We donapost have any children, this is all for us... but when my friends come they love it… say itaposs their favourite place to go to the loo in. “We were having the house completely done up and we just thought for the downstairs loo and hallway it would be fun and we just came up with the name Bogwarts. “Lots more have been added over the months, more wands and other bits... itaposs something you can add on to as you go along.”  Claire also decoupaged her toilet roll holder with a dferent Harry Potter wallpaper and playing cards that she had lying around the home. Additionally, she put together a D collage of film memorabilia, including a Howler and a dark mark sign from hama beads, which is glued to the sink unit. Those with arachnophobia may want to avoid Bogwarts though, as thereaposs also a giant model of the filmaposs spider Aragog.  Claire added: “I made the toilet roll holder from bits of wallpaper we had left and Harry Potter playing cards and a few Harry Potter bits I had collected along the way. “I also made the D Harry Potter collage that hangs in the bathroom. The shelves are from IKEA and are great for putting things on and hanging other bits off. “The rest of the bits are what I have picked up and found along the way.” It isnapost the only room in the house with a theme. Other rooms are decorated with inspiration from Disney, Game of Thrones, and s cartoons. title: tragic schoolgirl walked out moments
story: :root Tragic schoolgirl walked out moments after encore into path of Manchester Arena bomberOlivia Campbell-Hardy, , from Bury, was just five metres away from the suicide bomber when he detonated his deviceManchester bombing victim Olivia Campbell-HardyByJohn ScheerhoutLeonie Chao-Fong:,  Sep | commentsA schoolgirl who was “always making people laugh” was just five metres away from the Manchester Arena suicide bomber when he detonated his device, an inquiry has heard.Olivia Campbell-Hardy, , from Bury, left the concert hall after Ariana Grande had performed her encore and walked into the foyer toward the bomber.Nine seconds later, Salman Abedi detonated his device. She was seen lying motionless on the ground by CCTV, the public inquiry into the bombing heard.Olivia, known as Ollie or Liv, died from “unsurvivable” head and neck injuries and was one of the  people who died in the May  attack, reports the Manchester Evening News. She had attended the concert with her friend and around pm, had excitedly called her mother to say Ms Grande was about to come on stage.  Following the end of the concert, Olivia entered the City Room at .pm just seconds before the bomb went off, the inquiry heard. She was approximately five metres from Abedi at the moment of detonation. Footage showed her body did not move during the period after the bomb went off. A paramedic confirmed in a statement to the inquiry that he had placed a label on Olivia to identy that she was deceased.  A post-mortem examination concluded that Olivia had died of head and neck injuries while a  of experts appointed by the inquiry said her injuries were “unsurvivable”. Pathologists agreed that her death would have been “very rapid”, adding that it was likely that her injuries would have resulted in “immediate loss of consciousness”. Her mother, Charlotte Hodgson, told the inquiry that Olivia was “a beautul young girl who packed so much in her  years”, who loved sports, singing and make-up.  She said of her daughter: “She didnapost come into a room - she would make an entrance. She was always making people laugh and anything she did she could make it fun”. Olivia was a “hugely promising singer” for whom singing was “her le” and had previously auditioned for Britain’s Got Talent. In a statement from her father, Andrew Hardy, which was read out at the inquiry, he said Olivia loved spending time with her family and holidays, adding: “She was very much loved by all.” Her grandfather, Steve Goodman, told the inquiry Olivia was known for singing at family gatherings. Describing her as “loud and boisterous”, he said she was also “caring” and would always “fight for the underdog”. To her grandparents, “she was a joy”, he added. The chairman of the inquiry, Sir John Saunders, said: “Believe it or not there are times when even lawyers are lost for words and this is one of them. Can I just say, what a talent, what a waste and what a lovely person. title: uk weather forecast final mini
story: :root UK weather forecast: Final mini-heatwave of summer as Brits bask in C sunshineOn Thursday, London is predicted to see high temperatures of at least C before rising to C from FridayMost of England will be dry and bright Image: Humphrey NemarByWilliam WalkerNews Reporter:,  Sep | commentsParts of the UK will bask in balmy weather with a mini-heatwave forecast for the last time this year. The next three days will hit high temperatures of C in some regions. On Thursday London is predicted to see high temperatures of at least C before rising to C from Friday. But while the south and most of England and Wales will see warm, dry skies there will be ferocious winds and torrential rain further north.The Met Office has predicted apossevere gales and squally showersapos for the far north but with most areas staying aposdry, warm and fine.aposThe best conditions and high temperatures will be felt in the east and central parts of the UK, continuing over the coming days. Met Office meteorologist Alex Deakin told The Sun : “Plenty more sunshine across much of the country today.“Much of southern Scotland and certainly most of England and Wales will have another fine day of September sunshine. “Temperatures are responding to that sunshine, heading up into the low twenties - C, maybe C across parts of the south east.” Longer ranger forecasts had predicted the mercury will stay warm in many areas up to the weekend, with C forecast again in the coming days. And it could be the last of the balmy weather for . Speaking to the Express, forecaster Jim Dale, from the British Weather Services, said earlier that climate change has led to the UK’s summer often being extended into the first three weeks of September.Whereas in past decades the month would usher in autumn, it is not now unusual to see bright, dry and sunny weather well into the month, he explained. He said: “What we’re in for is an extended summary month for the first three weeks of September because of climate change. “What we are going into now is pretty weather, it’s very pleasing but it’s not probably a lot more than that.” UK weather forecast Today: Severe gales and squally showers at first across the far north, otherwise mostly dry, warm and fine with the best of any sunshine in eastern and central parts. Thicker cloud may bring some patchy rain at times to the west. Tonight: Mostly cloudy in the north and west with some rain or drizzle at times. Mostly dry with iable cloud and clear spells where. Becoming increasingly breezy especially in the north. Friday: Rather cloudy, especially in the west and north where some patchy rain is likely with the best of any sunshine in eastern parts. Breezy, particularly in northern areas. Feeling warm. Outlook for Saturday to Monday: Mainly fine and warm Saturday. Some rain for the northwest. Scattered showers overnight into Sunday, perhaps heavy in the east. Squally band of rain pushes east Sunday and into Monday. news uk-news who-lady-louise-windsor-queens-"Lady Louise Windsor shares memories of Prince PhilipByAriane Sohrabi-ShirazSEO Editor:,  Sep | commentsLady Louise Windsor stepped into the spotlight to commemorate her grandfather Prince Philip in a BBC documentary. Prince Philip: The Royal Family Remembers aired on BBC One on September , and featured interviews from all of the Queen and The Duke of Edinburghaposs children and adult grandchildren.Among those who paid tribute was Lady Louise, who recalled her close bond with Prince Philip and their shared love for carriage driving. Speaking to the camera about how her grandfather inspired her, the -year-old said: The Duke of Edinburgh has been so involved in my driving which has been so lovely but slightly scary because he invented the sport pretty much.Itaposs incredible to have learned first hand from him and definitely made us closer, I think.  The Duke of Edinburgh, who passed away on April  , took up carriage driving in the s, and taught the sport to his granddaughter. Itaposs evident that she and Prince Philip were close, but sources also claim she is the Queenaposs favourite grandchild. Who is Lady Louise Windsor  Lady Louise Alice Elizabeth Mountbatten-Windsor, , is the daughter of Prince Edward and Sophie, the Countess of Wessex. That makes her the grandchild of the Queen, , and her late husband Philip.Prince Edward is the youngest child of the Queen and the Duke of Edinburgh, and Louise is his eldest child with Sophie. Lady Louise was born on November  , and has one brother, -year-old James, Viscount Severn. She is currently th in line to the throne. Does Lady Louise Windsor have an eye condition  Lady Louise was born prematurely via emergency Caesarean section, and was born with with esotropia, a condition that turns the eyes outwards. She had dficulties with her vision growing up, and had her first eye procedure at just  months old.  The procedure to correct her vision was unsuccessful, leading to a second proceed in . Following the operation, Lady Louise can now see normally, according to Hello Magazine. Is Lady Louise Windsor the Queenaposs aposfavouriteapos grandchild There have been several reports that Lady Louise is the Queenaposs favourite grandchild due to their special bond. A Royal source previously told The Sun: The Queen loves the fact that Louise and James relish their time at Balmoral, and she has become particularly close to Louise, who seems to have become her favourite grandchild, closely followed by James. The Royal source added: “Louise also endeared herself to everyone by looking after William and Kate’s children when they were up here. “Louise loves drawing and sketching and was very patiently trying to get Charlotte to do pictures of rabbits and deer. Because of her obvious artistic skill, the Queen allowed Louise to look through some of the collection of Queen Victoria’s Highlands sketches which are kept at Balmoral but are rarely dug out these days.” While the spotlight mainly focuses on Princes William and Harry, the Queen has eight grandchildren, and she is said to be close with them all.Most ReadDont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Lady Louise WindsorThe Queen" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news woman-screams-horror-sea-creature-"TikTok user shows lump of mouldy fat she found in almond milkByAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep | commentsA woman was left screaming in horror after she said she discovered a mouldy mass resembling a sea creature inside a carton of Aldi almond milk. Nikky Afo claims she was horried when the grey blob flopped out the plant-based product. She shared the vile discovery on TikTok leading some viewers to promise they will never become vegan. The video, which has gone viral with .million views and counting, started with the caption: Aldi can you explain this  The womanaposs family can be heard howling in the background as cuts the almond milk carton to show the oyster-looking contents. A voiceover says: Aldi UK, we need answers. You will never believe what we found inside this almond milk carton. She then points out the use-by date, which is February , . The woman says: Look at this, holding the cartonaposs lid which is covered with gross-looking grey and blue mould. She continues: I just opened this and I could tell that there is something lumpy inside it. The woman explains how she can feel the blob sloshing in the packaging, before taking a pair of kitchen scissors to cut the carton open. She adds: Honestly, I always buy this milk but now I feel like throwing up everything I have had in the last year. Her family then bursts into nervous giggles as she tells them: Itaposs not funny honestly! As the grotesque blob emerges, another woman shrieks and runs back from the now-open carton. Nikky Afo also posted another video, showing the rank blob up close as she prods it with scissors. In the video, a voiceover explains: Aldi UK, we need answers. We bought this almond milk from the store and when my daughter wanted to make oats this is what she saw. It is still within the expiry date. Social media users flocked to the comments to share their horror at the minging mouldy milk. One said: I thought it was an octopus. Another jibed: Thataposs my ex. One viewer vowed: Iaposm eating cereal with water from now on. One joked: You got free lasagne with your almond milk. Be grateful! Another disgusted viewer said: Thataposs a whole sea creature. And another user advised: Donapost go vegan my friends. An Aldi spokesperson said: We apologise for any inconvenience this may have caused. We are trying to contact the customer to discuss this matter and offer further assistance. Although rare, incidents like this can occasionally occurthe packaging is damaged at any point before the product is consumed, as the contents may be exposed to air. title: womans routine eye test uncovered
story: :root Mums routine Specsavers eye-test after having blurred vision saved her leSarah Cardwell, who works at Leeds Beckett University, said she noticed in the summer of  that her vision was blurred - but just assumed she needed new prescription glassesSarah Cardwell in hospital after a routine eye test ended up with the discovery of a brain tumour Image: HandoutByLaura Withers:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep | commentsA mum whose routine eye test led to a terrying brain tumour diagnosis when an optician spotted something was wrong has described her ordeal. Sarah Cardwell, , went in for an opticians appointment in November , after suffering with blurred vision. The mum-of-two, who is working with the charity Brain Tumour Research, is now speaking out about her le-threatening ordeal in aid of National Eye Health Awareness Week. Sarah, who works at Leeds Beckett University, said she noticed in the summer of  that her vision was blurred - so thought she probably needed new prescription glasses.I only wore glasses for driving at the time,” she told Leeds Live.  “I kept telling myself to make an optician’s appointment but with a busy job and two young daughters, le got in the way and I kept putting it off. Finally, in November that year, Sarah booked an appointment at Specsavers in Guiseley, where an optometrist did a series of tests and tried, to no avail, to seeher sight was improved with ious dferent strengths of corrective lenses. Sarah was then told she was being referred to eye casualty at the hospital. Accompanied by her husband, Sarah went to the hospital the same day, where an ophthalmologist took a photo of the back of her eye and carried out a colour-blindness test. Sarah, who is mum to Lucy,  and Ellie, seven, said: “I didn’t get a single one right. He then asked lots of questions about whether I got tired easily and whether I had noticed any other unusual symptoms. When I thought about it, I had been prescribed iron tablets for anaemia and had also suffered some sickness and dizziness.  I had also been to the doctors with severe headaches but I thought they were probably due to being tired and over-stretched with a busy work and home le.Sarah was referred for an MRI scan that took place on  December . The scan revealed a ‘cyst’ on her brain and she was asked to go back the following day for another MRI.The following week, Sarah met a neurosurgeon who said he thought the mass was a craniopharyngioma, sitting on her optic nerve. She was advised that the surgeon wanted to operate the following day.She broke the news to her children that they wouldn’t see their mum for the next couple of days, as she would be in hospital undergoing surgery. “Luckily, they weren’t fazed at all. I, on the other hand, broke down,” Sarah said. The thought of possibly not seeing them again was just too much. I didn’t want to go to bed that night and I think I only managed about one hour’s sleep.” The operation lasted five hours and they went in through the sinus, meaning it was less invasive than conventional brain surgery. She was discharged on  December, in time to spend Christmas with her family. Sarah said: “The results of my first post-op MRI scan were in February and showed that things were stable. My next routine scan was due in December . However, in June, fate stepped in and I woke up one weekend with a tingling sensation in my eye. It felt all too familiar. Deep down I knew the tumour was back but I didn’t want to believe it.” Devastatingly, Sarah’s instinct was right and doctors confirmed she’d suffered a relapse of her tumour. On  July , she underwent a second brain surgery to treat the regrowth.Sarah said: “The operation seemed to go well and once again I stayed in hospital for five nights. This time, however, after being discharged from hospital, I suffered a cerebrospinal fluidleak and I contracted meningitis.I had to be re-admitted and have two further surgeries to fix the leak, which was a really gruelling experience.” Sarah is now having annual MRI scans and her tumour remains stable. She’s now sharing her brain tumour experience, to help encourage people to be aware of their eye health and to get checked upsomething seems wrong.  She said: “I put off going to the optician for ages. Now, I’m much more aware that a problem with your eyesight might be an indication of something serious. With hindsight, I wish I’d gone to Specsavers sooner. I’ve no doubt that that routine check-up saved my le. “Without my urgent appointment, my brain tumour diagnosis may have come too late and the consequences don’t bear thinking about. National Eye Health Awareness week takes place from  to  September and aims to inspire and educate people on the importance of eye health and why they should go for regular sight tests. Brain Tumour Research funds sustainable research at dedicated centres in the UK. It also campaigns for the Government and the larger cancer charities to invest more in research into brain tumours in order to speed up new treatments for patients and, ultimately, to find a cure.To make a donation to Brain Tumour Research, click here Comment MORE ON SpecsaversPrescriptions" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: young mum fell front high
story: :root Young mum fell in front of high-speed train with her three-year-old daughterLeighane Redmond, , had been suffering from psychosis when she and Melsadie Parris died at Taplow Station, on  February  - a full inquest is due to be held into both deathsLeighane Melsadie Redmond, , and her three-year-old daughter Melsadie Adella-Rae Parris Image: south bedsnews agency_sbna_fairleysByMirror:,  Sep A young mother fell in front of a high-speed train in Buckinghamshire with her three-year-old daughter, killing them both. Leighane Redmond, , had been suffering from psychosis when she and Melsadie Parris died at Taplow Station, on  February .British Transport Police said at the time they were treating the case as murder-suicide and the results of their investigations were expected to be revealed when the full inquest takes place,Bucks Free Press reports.At a pre-inquest review hearing held at Beaconsfield Coroners’ Court today, Buckinghamshire Senior Coroner Crispin Butler agreed to requests from lawyers for Melsadie’s father Leroy Parris and her mother Yvette Redmond to adjourn the full inquest hearing. The hearing was due to last four weeks from November . No new date for the full inquest was set, but there will be a pre-trial review on November .  The court today heard of how the death of Ms Redmond and her daughter could have been the result of inadequate fencing and hoardings at Taplow Station. Ms Redmond’s mother wants to invite a rail expert to help establish whether her daughter was let down by rail and contractor firms that were operating at the station on the day of her death. Yvette Redmond’s lawyer, Caoilfhionn Gallagher QC, told the court she was concerned the other parties would “mark their own homework” when assessing what happened on the day of the tragedy. “It is essential to have an expert,” Ms Gallagher said.  “There are ious standards on the railway. Without expert assistance, it will not be possible to knowthe interested parties adhered to their responsibilities.” The lawyer said it was crucial to have an independent assessment. The comments come after the family of the victims raised concerns over the fencing and hoardings at Taplow Station, which was undergoing construction works when the incident took place. Questions were also raised at a previous pre-inquest review as to why station staff did not interfere when Ms Redmond, who had struggled with mental health issues, had been standing with her daughter on the  for more than an hour. Ben Compton QC, representing MTR Elizabeth Line raised questioned over whether there was a need for a rail expert in the matter. “I just question how much a pure rail expert can really help in this case. The question is how Leighane and Melisade were able to access the high-speed  in Taplow Station,” he said. The hearing had been adjourned after around two hours. Another pre-inquest review was expected to take place ahead of the full four-week inquest later this year.  The Samaritans is available  you need to talk. You can contact them for free by calling  , email jo@samaritans.org or head to the website to find your nearest branch. title: diy bride spent just 3600
story: :root DIY bride spent just £, on her wedding day by making own dress and dessertsVictoria Croker, , saved thousands by crocheting her dress, her husbands tie and a pair of sandals for herself - she also baked  meringues and created her own floral centrepiecesVictoria Croker, , saved thousands by crocheting her dress by hand Image: Mercury Press  Media Ltd.ByJade CulverAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Sep | commentsA money-savvy bride spent just £ on her big day by making her own dress, decor and desserts. Victoria Croker, , saved thousands by crocheting her dress by hand, baking a iety of dessert meringues as well as creating her own centrepieces. The tattoo parlour general manager learned to crochet from her mum Laura Figlioa, , and her hobby helped save her thousands for her wedding day. Victoria, from New York, also used the leftover material to make a pair of sandals for herself and her husbandaposs tie. Victoria said: “It was always my dream to create my own wedding dress, I got to make it to my own specications, and it was super comfortable.  I was inspired by a few dferent crochet artists but I made the dress entirely by hand, I didn’t have a pattern for it. “With the off-cuts left over from the yarn, I managed to make myself some barefoot sandals for the day, my husband’s tie and pocket square. I also upcycled an old umbrella I had and got some yarn for that at a thrt store.”  Victoria was quoted more than £ for flowers and catering, and with dress prices in New York averaging out at thousands of pounds, she decided to put her skills to the test to slash the overall costs. In total, Victoria spent  hours and just under £ on speciality hand-dyed yarn creating her dress. To keep her dress hidden from her husband Travis, , she created the dress at work.Average dress price in New York: £,. - Victoria paid £. for material for her look Average professional centrepiece flower in New York: £,. - Victoria paid £. on fake flowers and bells Average professional catering dessert in New York: £ - Victoria paid £. for meringue ingredients All  wedding guests were impressed with Victoriaaposs DIY dress. She said: “My husband said that I looked like a princess, whilst others said that I looked like the Disney Princess Belle throughout the day.” Victoria also created her own centrepieces with plastic flowers from US craft shop Michaels and bells from the Dollar Store.  She was initially quoted £ for desserts and decided to save even more by spending eight hours creating  meringues in a iety of flavours. Victoria only spent £ - giving her a massive  per cent saving. She added: Iaposd say that I absolutely saved money on my wedding, especially with the dress, as in New York they tend to costs thousands. title: forgotten ghost town submerged underwater
story: :root Forgotten ghost town submerged underwater  years ago reappears in droughtDrone test pilot Devon Dewey shared incredible snaps on Twitter following a serious drought which revealed the foundations of the forgotten town of Rockport in Utah, USDrone pilot Devon Dewey captured incredible footage of the forgotten town of Rockport Image: Devon DeweyByDimitris KouimtsidisRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Sep | commentsA forgotten aposghost townapos that was submerged underwater after a dam was built has risen from its watery grave  years later. The town of Rockport in Utah, US, disappeared completely in  - five years after the White House green lit the construction of the Wanship Dam.At the time, a total of  families still lived in the once thriving little town, located in a narrow part of Weber Valley at the mouth of Three Mile Canyon, reports the Daily Star. The remaining residents protested against the development but the government went ahead and purchased the entire valley, and in preparation for the dam, created the Rockport Reservoir, quickly submerging the whole community.Last week, drone test pilot Devon Dewey shared incredible snaps on Twitter following a serious drought which revealed the foundations of the old town. Do you have any drone images to rival Devonaposs  Let us know at webnews@mirrorHe told KSL News : It was really interesting to be standing at an overlook for the reservoir and to see faint traces of foundations of old homes and a road all below where the water would normally be. The whole area is pretty flat and unorm, so even though the foundations are old and mostly gone, you can still see them clearlyyou know where to look.Using a drone to get a higher perspective helped to see where structures once stood over  years ago.  The town was first settled in . After the government purchased the land nearly a hundred years later, some of the buildings were removed so that they could be preserved for history. They were moved to Pioneer Village at Lagoon Amusement Park in Farmington. Following this year’s drought, only small boats and personal watercraft are allowed to launch, although officials have advised people to do so “at your own risk”. Even though water levels have declined, the ground may be muddy from years of being underwater, so officials have advised people to be cautious and use dronesthey want to see the remnants of the ‘ghost town’. news weird-news adorable-golden-retriever-puppy-tries-"Golden RetrieversByEdward KayNiche Video Journalist:,  Sep | commentsAnyone who has older siblings knows that playtime can sometimes get a bit rough - and the same is apparently true for dogs. A poor little Golden Retriever puppy, called Millie, only wanted to be included in her big sisters’ fun and games, but the little tyke struggled to get their attention due to her small stature.The clip, which was posted by the TikTok user @missygoldenretrievers, begins with Millie trying to get the attention of her much bigger sisters, who are busy play fighting, by jumping all over one of them.The puppy then attempts to get involved by biting at her sister’s leg, but this proves to not be enough to distract the larger dogs from their ongoing battle with one another.  Eventually, Millie resorts to jamming her face right into the middle of where her big sisters are attempting to bite at each other, before ing to her early tactic of leg nibbling. Sadly, Millie is unable to get the inclusion she is after this time, as her tiny frame simply doesn’t yet have the necessary size to get the attention she wants from her sisters. Viewers clearly felt sorry for the little pup, with one user commenting: “Poor Millie is being ignored.” TeamDogs is a community for dog lovers who want to get the most out of their relationship with their best pal. news weird-news amateur-tattooist-shares-first-ever-"TikTok tattoo artist shows off first inking on another clientByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep | commentsAn amateur tattooist has gone viral after sharing her first-ever inking - but it didnapost go as planned as people flocked to the video to beg her to not do another one.TikTok star Sam, @ descendantofsalemwitches, dreams of one day becoming a professional tattoo artist - but she might have some way to go.She recently completed her first tattoo on a real-le person, and unveiled it in a TikTok video that has since gone viral, receiving over five million views. It also received countless comments, mostly from people urging Sam to quit - saying she should have practised more before committing to tattooing someone.What do you think about the tattoo  Let us know in the comments...In the video, Sam unveils the tattoo which is a minimalist outline of a womanaposs face with a rose over one eye, which was inked onto a red-haired womanaposs back. Captioning the video, Sam wrote: I have to say itaposs not bad for my first time tattooing on someone other than myself. I was nervous. But it appears that other TikTok users didnapost agree with her, as many were not impressed. One wrote: Did you do it blindfolded while jumping on a trampoline For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. And another said: Why do something so massive for your first time  You gotta start from somewhere, but bro, added a third user. You shouldaposve practised more. It is bad and thataposs just a fact. And another user had creative feedback, and wrote: Sausage fingers, wonky everything, bad line quality, lashes are - ooft. Please donapost tell me thataposs an infinity symbol, oh Lord. Sam then replied askingthe user had anything  to say, to which they wrote: Yeah, do not tattoo anyone until youaposre actually ready. In the clip, Sam reveals her artwork by wiping her clientaposs back with a paper towel - but that angered TikTok viewers too as people noticed she wasnapost wearing protective gloves. One user said: If you actually want a future in tattooing, take this down. No decent tattoo shop would hire someone blatantly ignoring biohazard safety like this. And another commented: No gloves  Did you close your eyes during the bloodborne pathogens training Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. title: flight attendants secret code used
story: :root Flight attendant uses codewords to talk about passengers without them knowingA flight attendant has shared a secret code that she uses to talk about passengers to other cabin crew without them knowing, and you might have heard it about yourselfCabin crew use secret codes to refer to people on the plane Image: Getty ImagesByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep | commentsA flight attendant has shared her secret code that she uses to talk about plane passengers without their knowledge. Known only as LJ, the woman said that often she will talk to other members of the cabin crew about passengers that she finds attractive, but she does it in secret.She said that the code she uses is universally understood, and others in the know will reply in kind to comment their opinion - and all the while the passengers are in the dark, as the Daily Star reports.LJ said she will refer to passengers as food, asking others aposwhat do you want to have for dinner tonightapos, and the other member of the cabin crew will say whether they would eat that food too. Speaking on the Confessions on the Fly podcast, flight attendant LJ said: I’ve picked up a dude on an aircraft, on my way to Austin four years ago. He was really cute. We had a couple of fun dates.My co-worker and I had this code ‘what do you want to have for dinner tonight ’ And you would say Italian or this or that. But we were really talking about the dudes coming on the aircraft. So we would have a code of like ‘no, I’m not really hungry for that’ or when somebody hot was coming on I’d be like, ‘oh yeah I’ll definitely go out for that tonight’. When somebody came on who was really really cute, I was like ‘oh yeah I definitely want whatever it was – Italian – for the night’. LJ then explained in further detail how she and her flight attendant friend Tony had employed their secret code to successfully get a passengers’ number. I bought him a drink on the aircraft and then when he came to the back of the aircraft to go to the restroom, my co-worker started talking to him, just warming him up or whatever, she continued. And then I jumped in and Tony casually walks to the front of the aircraft and gives us time to chat… and then I got his number. On the podcast episode, LJ also shared some tips for passengers who might want to make a move on cabin crew. Her main piece of advice, she noted, was that passengers should not try it on while attendants are doing service. That’s very awkward... If you want to grab our attention, being nice and courteous is rule number one, she added. Saying please and thank yous…you ask me how my day is or anything like that, I am so totally thrown off guard, because nobody talks to me other than to ask for a diet coke or whatever. So that, number one, perks me up and makes me actually look at you and pay attention.Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. title: man shares dating tip thats
story: :root Man shares dating tip thats been passed down his family - and he swears by itIts easy to get confused about whether your partner is a good fit for you, but how do you knowtheyre the one  Its easy, according to one Reddit user - take them on holidayA man has shared a dating tip that has been passed down his family for generations Image: Getty ImagesByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Sep | commentsA man has shared a dating hack that has been passed down his family and he swears by it - saying it works every time. Sharing his story anonymously, he said that checkingyour partner is the right person for you is easy - just go on a long holiday with them. That way, you see them in a number of dferent lights - how they act in an airport, how they handle pressure, and how they adapt to dferent scenarios. The man said he inherited the advice from his dad, and took to Reddit to share it with others so they could benefit from it too. What do you think about the manaposs advice  Let us know in the commentsHe said: Hereaposs some advice my dad gave me: If you want to find out for yourselfthat girl is right for you, plan a long holiday with her. Travelling is a good way to get a glimpse of what living with her will be like: Youaposll be sharing a room, planning the itinerary, and learning how to negotiate and discuss with her when deciding what to do and where to go. Youaposll see all the bad and good habits she may have. Is she street smart  Does she know how to keep herself safe in a foreign land  Whatthings go south Does she have a plan B of where to go and what to do For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. How would you two solve problems together  Whatyou want to stay in a resort but she wants to stay in a motel  How prepared is she when exploring the unknown with you  These are all good qualities a le partner should have. After sharing the advice online, other Reddit users were quick to comment on the post and many agreed with the original poster. One said: There is a saying in our culture, aposto really know a person you have to either live with them or travel with themapos. And another said: I think it’s right - spending time in an unknown place and seeing how they deal with stuff is key. The other thing is building something with them. I took myself to Thailand a number of years ago for a month wrote a third. The amount of couples having ious fightswas surprising. I think being tired and away from home in less comfort that you are used to can bring out your true colours, or at least expose dferences.Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. title: mum sleep one eye open
story: :root Mum to sleep with one eye open after daughters gt is ornament meant to mark deathA mum has joked shell be sleeping with one eye open from now on after her -year-old daughter accidentally gted her a memorial candle for her birthday, intended to mark a deathHayleigh with the candle Image: Kennedy News and MediaByCourtney PochinAudience WriterHelen Le Caplain:,  Sep | commentsOn Tuesday, September , Hayleigh Austin was opening carefully-wrapped birthday presents from her children, when she got a bit of a shock. The -year-old had already been gted an ornamental elephant and a bottle of gin from two of her daughters, Sophea and Kaytlyn. When she got to the third, from her -year-old daughter Jesyka, she tore off the paper to find a candle in her favourite scent, vanilla. It smelled amazing and seemed like the perfect present - until Hayleigh caught sight of what was written on the glass jar. Her daughter sheepishly apologised that the candle didnapost say aposmumapos on it, which is when the PA support worker took a closer look at the text. She read a heartfelt message designed for remembering aposa le so beautully lived, a heart so deeply lovedapos and realised the candle was intended as a memorial ornament, to mark a death - despite her being very much alive.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.Stunned Hayleigh burst out laughing at the birthday blunder and joked sheaposd be sleeping aposwith one eye openapos in future. Despite the candle being for someone whoaposs dearly departed, Hayleigh said sheaposs not apostoo superstitiousapos to light it at some point - providing the words are facing away from her. The parent, from Great Bardfield, Essex, said: I guess Iaposll be sleeping with one eye open [from now on]. I think there was an ulterior motive - they were going to get me drunk, hit me over the head with the elephant, bury me and light the candle in memory. The candle is currently sitting on my bedroom side with the words facing the wall. Jesyka did say I could turn the bow round and not look at the words. I feel safe enough lighting it at some point, Iaposm not too superstitious.  The mum shared the hilarious mishap on social media where it quickly went viral, racking up more than , likes, shares and comments. Her post reads: Today is my birthday and my wonderful husband took our kids out to let them choose their own present which was super sweet. Three-year-old chose an elephant ornament as she said it matched my bedroom. Six-year-old chose gin coz in her words aposyouaposre always drinking ginapos. And -year-old bought me my favourite scent of candle which I thought smelt amazing until I read the words on the front. Guess Iaposll be sleeping with one eye open tonight and the husband learnt the valuable lesson of always checking the kidsapos choice of presents. What funny gts have you randomly received   Hayleigh continued to say that her -year-old electrical engineer hubby Ricky Austin, took the girls shopping for the gts Rickyaposs in charge of taking them out every year for my birthday presents and they each get to pick a present.Theyaposre normally quite good, he does have a little bit of influence sometimes for the younger ones because otherwise, I would end up with a Peppa Pig toy.Ricky had no idea until it came to wrapping it up the night before my birthday. Heaposs last-minute so by the time he did notice it, it was too late then. Jesyka was so determined to give me the candle because she knows that I love vanilla, so he wrapped it up. Weaposre quite a jokey, light-hearted family so he knew Iaposd see the funny side of it. I could smell it from the bag and I said aposah it smells amazingapos and she looked at me and said aposIaposm really sorry about the candleapos. I asked why she was sorry and she said aposbecause it doesnapost say mum on itapos. When I read it and saw it was an aposin loving memory candleapos I was in hysterics. My husband was laughing, Jesyka was laughing, it was very funny. After the present blunder, Hayleigh said Ricky had learned a valuable lesson and will check future purchases more closely. The mum added: The candle is currently sitting on my bedroom side with the words facing the wall. We had a good laugh about it. Ricky said in future he will check all presents properly.Whataposs the funniest gt youaposve ever been given  Let us know in the comments below.Comment MORE ON BM LimitedBirthday partyParentingFunny ha ha viral" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: true identity ron weasleys patronus
story: :root True identity of Ron Weasley’s patronus leaves even the hardcore Harry Potter fans puzzledIt’s absolutely not a Jack Russell but it is a four-legged creature mentioned in Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find ThemWhat is the true identity of Rons patronus  Image:  Getty ImagesByOliviaRose Fox:,  Sep | commentsAsk any Harry Potter fanatic and they are likely to be able to reel off what each character’s patronuses are. You’ve got Harry Potter’s stag, Luna Lovegood’s hare, Albus Dumbledore’s phoenix and Ron Weasley’s...well...terrier. For those not in the know, a patronus is a defensive spell that produces a glowing silveranimal. Each wizard has their own unique creature although these can change in certain cases such as during bereavement or falling in love. For as long as Harry Potter has been in our lives, there has always been debate surrounding what Ron Weasley’s patronus actually is with the majority believing that it is a Jack Russell.A quick Google will even point you to a multitude of fan-run wiki pages and websites, many detailing this particular breed of dog as Ron’sso it’s no surprise that so many of us have simply accepted this to be the truth.But Ron’s actual patronus is, in fact, a Crup.  Ron is pure bloodand lives in a magical community so when you think about it, he wouldn’t have a domestic muggle animal as his patronus, he would have a magical one. So what is a Crup  In J.K Rowling’s world, a Crup is a wizarding breed of dog that looks deceptively similar to a Jack Russell, apart from one defining feature - a forked tail.According to the Fantastic Beasts website : “The Crup originated in the southeast of England. It closely resembles a Jack Russell terrier, except for the forked tail.“The Crup is almost certainly a wizard-created dog, as it is intensely loyal to wizards and ferocious towards Muggles. It is a great scavenger, eating anything from gnomes to old tyres. Crup licences may be obtained from the Department for the Regulation and Control of Magical Creatures on completion of a simple test to prove the applicant wizard is capable of controlling the Crup in Muggle-inhabited areas. “Crup owners are legally obliged to remove the Crup’s tail with a painless Severing Charm while the Crup is six to eight weeks old, lest Muggles notice it.” TeamDogs is a community for dog lovers who want to get the most out of their relationship with their best pal. Make sharing the cutest photos of your dog your first job on the website and after youaposve done that, leave a tip to help fellow dog owners live their best lives as a proud pooch parent. Search through hundreds of recommended walks, treats, toys and places to stay when youaposre on an adventure together. From dog-friendly pubs to product reviews and the latest news, you can snf it all out at TeamDogs. So, you can see where the confusion lies - for what is the dference between a Crup with a snipped tail and a run of the mill Jack Russell. To add to the uncertainty, in the film adaption of the Order of the Phoenix, Ron’s patronus is portrayed as a Jack Russell Terrier. In the books it is only mentioned as ‘a terrier’. While J.K Rowling herself described Ron’s patronus as being ‘like a Jack Russell’ - notice the ‘like’. This leaves us with one outstanding dilemma, just how would a wizard be able to tell the dference between a Crup and a Jack Russell  It turns out, without the forked tail there is no dference. When shown in Hagridaposs Care of Magical Creatures class, the narrator describes it as aposindistinguishable from a Jack Russell terrier except for its forked tailapos. Anyway, you can thank us later when you get full marks at the Harry Potter pub quiz. title: woman horrified after being asked
story: :root Woman horried after being asked to live stream birth so family dont miss outA woman thought shed come up with a great way to make sure she was part of her grandchilds birth as she asked her pregnant daughter to live stream the occasion - but the pregnant daughter was not on boardA pregnant woman was shocked when she was asked to live-stream the birth of her son Image: Getty ImagesByJohn BettAudience WriterSamantha BartlettSenior Lestyle  Travel Reporter:,  Sep | commentsA pregnant woman was horried after being asked to live stream the birth of her son - so that her family could watch and not aposmiss outapos. Sharing her story anonymously, the woman said she was aposover the moon excitedapos at the news that she was  weeks pregnant, but due to the pandemic she wouldnapost be able to share the special moment with everyone.The hospital where she would be giving birth had a ban on visitors and her mother wasnapost best please about the situation - so she came up with a solution, as the Daily Star reports.She suggested that the womanaposs partner could live stream the birth so that all the family could enjoy the moment by tuning in from home - but she promptly refused. Would you live stream your birth  Let us know in the comments...Taking to Reddit, the woman said: While our families are heartbroken, my mother has taken it the hardest. Today while on the phone with her, she asked that we live stream Zoom the birth of our son. She made it clear she didn’t wanna see … everything … just enough to see our faces and hear his first cry, etc. The woman explained that she didnapost want to broadcast such an intimate moment.For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. She said: I donapost want to have to worry about our families on Zoom while bringing our son into the world. It seems very personal to me, and I donapost like the idea of them watching me push, potentially hearingthere are complications, watching him be put on my chest etc. Fellow Reddit users reassured her that she was well within her rights to tell her mum she wanted privacy. One wrote: Tell your mom aposNo, not during the birth. We will video chat with you after the birth and as soon as weaposre settled in.apos If sheaposs a real s*** about it you can always blame it on the doctor or hospitalaposs rules. While another added: Oh no… this sounds like the worst idea ever. Hubby can take some well-posed photos once the baby is born and cleaned up a bit and is sitting in your arms. You do not need to entertain this request any further. A third also firmly told her: It’s your labour and delivery, you get to do whatever the hell you want. Tell her you aren’t comfortable with that idea, end of discussion. Being in the delivery room is a privilege, not a right.Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. title: your child could next mini
story: :root Your child could be the next mini Birds Eye Captain and be featured on Fish Finger packsDoes your little one love Fish Fingers  If so Birds Eye and Iceland are launching an exciting search to find one lucky child who will have the chance to become the new mini Captain Birds EyeDoes your child love Fish Fingers Image: Getty ImagesByCourtney PochinAudience Writer:,  Sep | commentsCalling all wannabe Captains, Birds Eye and frozen experts at Iceland have some news for you.They are searching the high seas to find a new aposminiapos Captain Birds Eye to replace the iconic captain on packs of Fish Fingers in Iceland stores across the UK for a limited time.And all your little one has to do to be in with a chance of winning the prize is submit their very own unique Birds Eye Fish Finger recipe, along with the inspiration behind the tasty creation. The nationwide competition is open to children aged  to  years old.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.Mike Sowerby, Marketing Manager at Birds Eye, said: We know children are much more engaged in mealtimesthey are involved in cooking the food they eat. We want to inspire and encourage children to get creative with a mealtime staple, think Fish Finger pancakes with a dollop of custard, we want to see the most creative, inventive, yet tastiest recipes out there. We hope by crowning a talented Mini Captain on our iconic Fish Finger packs, it will inspire families across the nation to get their little ones involved in mealtimes and explore where their food comes from.Andrew Staniland, Trading Director, at Iceland Foods, added: Mealtimes are all about family time and Birds Eye Fish Fingers have always been a staple in Iceland’s freezers and on the tables of UK families. We’re delighted to be teaming up with Birds Eye once again to find the newest Mini Captain Birds Eye.For mealtime inspiration, budding Captains can head into Iceland stores to get all their ingredients to make the winning dish from pre-chopped vegetables to herbs and spices frozen and ready to go there’s everything needed for a show-stopping dish.Parents can help children nominate themselves by submitting their Birds Eye Fish Finger recipe via www.birdseyeminicaptain to be in with a chance of winning the unique prize.Entries close on th October  and the winning Mini Captain will be featured on limited-edition packs exclusively at Iceland in January .Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: brit dad who traveled afghanistan
story: :root Brit dad who flew to Kabul to rescue family from Taliban stranded in AfghanistanA British man who went to Afghanistan to rescue his we and child as the Taliban re-seized control of the war-torn country has said they still "havent heard anything yet" regarding their evacuationTaxi driver Ahmed is stranded in Afghanistan after ing to rescue his familyByClaire Gilbody-DickersonNews reporter:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep | commentsA British man who went to Afghanistan to rescue his family when it was retaken by the Taliban claims they are still waiting to be evacuated a month later. The dad, who the BBC refers to as Ahmed to protect his identity, said he had gone to Kabul to save his we and child when the situation imploded as US-led coalition forces withdrew. Ahmed said he was given a reference number after registering with the Foreign Office, but a month on they still havenapost heard anything yet. The taxi driver from Liverpool said there have been five bombs near where he lives in the past couple of days, and leaving the house for food has also become too risky.Have you been affected by the crisis in Afghanistan  If so please get in touch at webnews@mirrorIf I say we are only breathing at the moment [it] isnapost a lie, he told BBC North West Tonight.We cannot even leave our homes for food because of a horrendous situation outside. As a British national we should have been evacuated by now, he said. Itaposs been over a month now. The family have kept changing addresses to disguise that they were among the thousands of desperate Afghans who tried to flee to escape the Taliban rule. Ahmedaposs friend in Liverpool described him as petried, especially as he fears becoming an easy target because living in the UK has westernised him. The Taliban dramatically regained control of Kabul on August , with the Afghan government collapsing in almost no time as US and UK troops controversially withdrew. The troopsapos withdrawal put an end to a -year war waged by the US and allied forces in retaliation for the Al-Qaedaaposs   attacks that killed , people. The Mirror has contacted the Foreign Office for comment.
